Mode.name: CLB
Mode.Description: Managed Climb (CLB) follows the vertical profile defined in the Flight Management System (FMS), including altitude constraints and speed targets appropriate for the climb phase.
Mode.Activation: Activated by pushing the Altitude selector knob when the selected altitude is above the current altitude and a valid FMS vertical profile is available.
Mode.Behavior: The aircraft follows the FMS-defined climb path. Autothrust commands climb thrust, and speed may be managed or selected depending on pilot input. The mode transitions to ALT* when approaching the selected altitude.
